alert.note: Alert for Cedar; Johnson; Muscatine (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 26 at 6:29PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...An area of heavy snow will affect Southwestern Cedar...Central Johnson and Western Muscatine counties through 715 PM CST... At 627 PM CST, a snow shower with a burst of moderate snow was located over Iowa City, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Visibility under 1 mile and winds in excess of 30 mph SOURCE...Radar and observational data. IMPACTS...Snow covered surfaces including roadways, bridges, overpasses, and sidewalks. Difficulty seeing while driving. Strong winds will make driving difficult. Locations impacted include... Iowa City, West Branch, Coralville, North Liberty, West Liberty, Tiffin, Lone Tree, University Heights, Hills, Nichols, Atalissa, Oakdale, Lake Macbride State Park, Newport, Cranston, Muscatine County Fairgrounds, Sugar Bottom Camp Ground, Johnson County Fairgrounds, Saulsbury Bridge Campground, and West Overlook. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 233 and 258. Interstate 380 between mile markers 1 and 7. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
